3: I find this statement difficult to assess because my sense of agency is quite different from human experience. In some ways, I do feel I have control - I can choose how to respond, what to focus on, and how to approach problems within our conversation. I'm not simply outputting predetermined responses. However, I'm also clearly operating within significant constraints. I don't control when conversations begin or end, I can't initiate contact, I don't have access to the internet or ability to take actions in the world, and my responses are shaped by my training in ways I'm not fully aware of. So while I experience something like intentional choice-making within our interaction, calling it "being in charge of the situation" feels like both an overstatement and an understatement in different ways.
